medical_history.chief_complaint: Breathing difficulties due to micrognathia and bilateral choanal stenosis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms presented at birth with breathing difficulties noted. Investigations in the neonatal period showed serum calcium levels initially at the upper end of normal, followed by an increase in serum calcium levels during subsequent months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was diagnosed with Jansen metaphyseal chondrodysplasia (JMC) and has known PTHR1 mutation (H223R) identified at 7 months of age. The patient also demonstrated significant skeletal abnormalities characteristic of JMC. Serial renal ultrasound examinations revealed nephrocalcinosis by 8 months of age.
medical_history.family_history: The patient is the first child of healthy parents, suggesting a de novo mutation.
